titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Douglas Connell Slides of Mississippi River Bridge Construction (La Crosse, Wisconsin), 2003-2004 MSS 104
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Christine Stolz

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit 2011-12-20T11:55-0600

did.unittitle: Douglas Connell Slides of Mississippi River Bridge Construction (La Crosse, Wisconsin)
did.repository:
La Crosse Public Library
Contact Information
did.abstract:
Douglas Connell, a La Crosse, Wis., native, is a local historian and writer for the La Crosse Tribune. He has written numerous books on La Crosse area history.
The collection includes 311 images of the construction of the new bridge over the Mississippi River at La Crosse, Wis., from March 2003 to November 2004. The slides are arranged chronologically in a binder. Each slide is labeled by Connell with a brief description and the date and time the image was taken.

acqinfo.head: Acquisitions Information
acqinfo.p: (Accession no. 2006.049) Donated by Douglas Connell, 2006 May

accessrestrict.head: Access to Materials
accessrestrict.p: Materials in this collection are available for patron use.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], Douglas Connell Slides of Mississippi River Bridge Construction (La Crosse, Wisconsin), MSS 104, La Crosse Public Library Archives, La Crosse, WI

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The collection includes 311 images of the construction of the new bridge over the Mississippi River at La Crosse, Wis., from March 2003 to November 2004. The slides are arranged chronologically in a binder. Each slide is labeled by Connell with a brief description and the date and time the image was taken.
A photographic agreement between Douglas Connell and the La Crosse Public Library is included with the collection.

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Douglas Connell, a La Crosse, Wis., native, is a local historian and writer for the La Crosse Tribune. He has written several books on La Crosse area history, such as True Tales of La Crosse: Unusual Stories from Old Newspapers of La Crosse, Wisconsin; La Crosse Time Trip; and co-authored In Light and Shadow: A Pictorial Recollection of La Crosse, Wisconsin. Connell also did a lot of research for the MacMillan family history book.

Connell began researching the history of his hometown in 1985 and began when doing family history. He graduated from the University of Wisconsin-La Crosse with a degree in elementary education. The Preservation Alliance of La Crosse honored Connell with an award for educating the public about the citys history.
